original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.🔽Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā mahākaccāno bhagavato avidūre nisinno hoti pallaṅkaṁ ābhujitvā ujuṁ kāyaṁ paṇidhāya kāyagatāya satiyā ajjhattaṁ parimukhaṁ sūpaṭṭhitāya.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme  tena khalu pana samayena āyasmā mahākaccānaḥ bhagavataḥ avidūre nisinnaḥ hoti pallaṅkam ābhujitvā ujum kāyam paṇidhāya kāya gatāya satiyā ajjhattam parimukham su upaṭṭhitāya
translated: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Savatthi in Jeta’s Grove, Anathapindika’s Park.🔽Now on that occasion the venerable Maha Kaccana was sitting not far from the Blessed One, his legs crossed, his body held erect, with mindfulness directed to the body.

original: Addasā kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ mahākaccānaṁ avidūre nisinnaṁ pallaṅkaṁ ābhujitvā ujuṁ kāyaṁ paṇidhāya kāyagatāya satiyā ajjhattaṁ parimukhaṁ sūpaṭṭhitāya.
analyzed: addasā khalu bhagavā āyasmantam mahākaccānam avidūre nisinnam pallaṅkam ābhujitvā ujum kāyam paṇidhāya kāya gatāya satiyā ajjhattam parimukham su upaṭṭhitāya
translated: The Blessed One saw the venerable Maha Kaccana sitting not far away, his legs crossed, his body held erect, with mindfulness directed to the body.

original: Atha kho bhagavā etamatthaṁ viditvā tāyaṁ velāyaṁ imaṁ udānaṁ udānesi:
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etam attham viditvā tāyam velāyam imam udānam udānesi
translated: Then, knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Blessed One uttered this inspired utterance:

original: Satataṁ kāyagatā upaṭṭhitā;🔽No cassa no ca me siyā,
analyzed: satatam kāya gatā upaṭṭhitā  no ca assa no ca me siyā
translated: Who is ever established in body-contemplation,🔽‘It is not’ and ‘It will not be’

original: Na bhavissati na ca me bhavissati;
analyzed: na bhavissati na ca me bhavissati
translated: And ‘It is not mine’ will be known.
One who abides in the gradual higher attainments
Will cross over attachment to the world.”
